About the job
Trade Operations Engineer – Leading Systematic Quant Trading Firm – Singapore

A leading global systematic trading firm with over 1,000 employees is seeking a Junior Trade Operations Engineer to help oversee its global trading activities. As a Junior Trade Operations Engineer, you will be part of the team that ensures a multi-billion-dollar automated trading operation runs flawlessly. This is not a back-office role—this is front-line engineering at the core of a world-class quantitative trading firm.

Requirements
1–3 years of professional experience with Python
Strong knowledge of Linux operating systems
Solid understanding of PnL and risk reporting tools or applications
Fast learner with strong communication skills
Professional experience in financial services
Trade operations/support experience is a plus
Bachelor’s degree or higher in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or a related field

Responsibilities
Oversee and support live trading operations, including real-time trade flow monitoring, risk checks, and resolving position or reconciliation discrepancies.
Enhance and maintain the automated trading infrastructure by contributing to the codebase, implementing programmatic solutions, and coordinating software and hardware upgrades.
Drive cross-team operational initiatives through project management, collaboration with support teams, and continuous improvement of trading workflows.

Work-life balance
At Radley James we want our employees to enjoy a good work-life balance as we know that having this enables our team to thrive and ultimately become better at their jobs. We do this by having a flexible work-from-home policy. Our current policy allows employees to work from home where they can. We like to encourage at least 2 days per week in the office, but this is on a person-by-person basis. We have employees from overseas that have gone back to work in their home countries for a period of time, employees that have moved overseas and work remotely. Alongside our WFH policy, we offer flexi-working for parents returning to work after having a child.
